page.title: 06Stagsden Past
page.content: One elderly resident recalls the changes in his lifetime,although some thatched cottages remain today there were many more,including a group of 8 (now replaced by modern bungalows).Perhaps the single biggest impact on the village has been the increase in traffic along the A 422. Pre war, flocks of sheep and cattle were driven along the road. The majority of the village was self-supporting, keeping poultry and pigs for there own use and tending 20 pole allotments despite working long hours on the farm. 2 of the allotment areas were called New Zealand and Van Diemans. People knew what you meant if you said you were going to New Zealand for the evening! Half the allotment was vegetables, half wheat,which together with gleanings would provide the family with flour.
